summary.p: In the [Basel] council, there was a discussion on this day about the punishment to be awarded to the [Basel] mercenaries; as soon as Gast learns more about it, he will write. The book with the pasquinades [“Pasquillorum tomi duo”] is a collection of texts that were written over many years; this work consists of about 50 printed sheets, 2 parts, and an [appendix], including the “Pasquillus extaticus”; Gast will inquire with Oporin. Bullinger sends Oecolampadius's sermons on the Lamentations of Jeremiah [“Inn die clag Hieremie”], which he had recorded [in 1527]; if these find the approval of the scholars, he will attempt something similar with [Oecolampadius's sermons on] Ezekiel and Daniel. [In Basel] more than a hundred Swiss soldiers have died, and every day plundered, miserable [soldiers] return; in the inn, 54 [of them] are bedridden. Soon Gast will send the new catechism by Myconius, unless Bullinger has already received it from the author; unfortunately, it does not sufficiently elaborate on the teaching of the Gospels in contrast to the scholastics. A preacher from Strasbourg [Konrad Hubert?] reports that a Frenchman [Pierre Brully] was arrested in the southern Netherlands and is destined for the flames; this shows the disposition of the Emperor [Charles V.] against the [evangelical] churches.

div.p: Greetings. Today, the senate deliberated on the punishment to be inflicted on our soldiers; however, I still do not know what was concluded. All were brought in; they have relatives in the senate. If anything is decided about them, I will write soon.

The book of pasquinades has been divided into two volumes; it has nearly 50 sheets, in which all the pasquinades written over many years are included. The "Pasquillus extaticus" has been expanded, and certain pasquinades have been added. I will consult with Oporin on this matter.

I am sending you the sermons on the Lamentations of Jeremiah by our Oecolampadius, which I transcribed from his mouth. If I see that my work is pleasing to the learned, I will attempt the same with the prophet Ezekiel and Daniel. More than a hundred Swiss soldiers have breathed their last with us; every day some miserable ones return wretched and poor, 54 of them are bedridden in the hospital, and this is a notable plague from God.

Soon I will send the new Catechism of our Myconius; but perhaps you have already received it from the author himself; the good father does not sufficiently consider what principal doctrine should be proposed to the scholars in the business of the Gospel.

Some of the preachers from Strasbourg say that a Frenchman in Lower Germany has been captured by the Emperor's forces because of religion and sentenced to the flames. These are the beginnings of sorrows; hence it appears what disposition the Emperor has towards our churches and what he is planning and contemplating. But the Lord will not forsake His church if we truly repent.
On the day of Conrad, 1544. Hastily.
Greet Theodor in my name along with your wife and children. Yours sincerely, Gastius.
To the most vigilant pastor of the Zurich church, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, his dearest brother in the Lord.
